meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, she had to acclimatize to the thin air.
meanings.sent2: It takes time to acclimatize to the hot weather in this region.
meanings.sent3: Trying to acclimatize to the freezing cold by wearing shorts was not a smart idea.
meanings.sent4: Her body had to acclimatize to the high altitude like a mountaineer preparing for a summit.
meanings.sent5: The plants slowly acclimatized to the dry desert conditions, thriving against all odds.

meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The new student needed to acclimatize to the school's daily routine.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to acclimatize to a different work environment.
meanings.sent3: He tried to acclimatize to the noisy city by wearing earplugs everywhere.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to acclimatize to the fast-paced lifestyle of the city dwellers.
meanings.sent5: The puppy quickly acclimatized to its new home, wagging its tail in excitement.
